About me

Hello world, I'm Larry! Iâ€™m a college student from the Atlanta Metropolitan Area that is practicing front-end website developing. The course I use to learn front-end developing is freeCodeCamp, a non-profit site whose mission is to teach people how to code. I'm also an engineering student that's aspiring to major in Computer Engineering, so Computer Science is a part of my main course work.

My works

A few projects are a part of the freeCodeCamp Curriculum, a few are because I wanted to play around and learn something new. Works that are shown are not limited to front-end projects. Please do feel free to contact me in regard to any of my projects.

Presidential Tribute

To put to work the first skills learned from the freeCodeCamp Curriculum, the website asks that users create a tribute/bio website of a famous person. At the time I choose president Barak Obama. The Website is made of basic HTML and CSS and no frameworks.

  • See on Codepen
  • See stand alone.

First attempt at Portfolio

One of the bigger first projects of freeCodeCamp, the portfolio was meant to be a project in itself and and it was meant to show off other projects. This website is made of HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap.

  • See on Codepen
  • See stand alone

Time Converter written in Java

One of the first homeworks in my Computer Science I class, we were tasked to make a program that asked the user the amount of Years, Months, Days, Hours, Minutes they wanted to convert into seconds. I wrote up a much more detailed exponation on what were the requirements and restrictions, what it does, and what I learned. That write up can be found in the links down below.
